testcase.name: testShouldExtractClientCertificatesFromSSLServerSocketWithAnyClientAuth
testcase.system-err: [main] INFO org.apache.nifi.security.util.CertificateUtilsTest - Expected DN: CN=ncm.nifi.apache.org,OU=Security,O=Apache,ST=CA,C=US [main] INFO org.apache.nifi.security.util.CertificateUtilsTest - Expected certificate chain: C=US,ST=CA,O=Apache,OU=Security,CN=ncm.nifi.apache.org issued by C=US,ST=CA,O=Apache,OU=Security,CN=NiFi Test CA [main] INFO org.apache.nifi.security.util.CertificateUtilsTest - Running test with socket ClientAuth setting: [SslContextFactory]type=Requireddescription=Requests the client certificate on handshake and rejects the connection if it is not present and valid [main] INFO org.apache.nifi.security.util.CertificateUtilsTest - Extracted server DN: CN=ncm.nifi.apache.org, OU=Security, O=Apache, ST=CA, C=US [main] INFO org.apache.nifi.security.util.CertificateUtilsTest - Running test with socket ClientAuth setting: [SslContextFactory]type=Wantdescription=Requests the client certificate on handshake and validates if present but does not require it [main] INFO org.apache.nifi.security.util.CertificateUtilsTest - Extracted server DN: CN=ncm.nifi.apache.org, OU=Security, O=Apache, ST=CA, C=US [main] INFO org.apache.nifi.security.util.CertificateUtilsTest - Running test with socket ClientAuth setting: [SslContextFactory]type=Nonedescription=Does not request the client certificate on handshake [main] INFO org.apache.nifi.security.util.CertificateUtilsTest - Extracted server DN: CN=ncm.nifi.apache.org, OU=Security, O=Apache, ST=CA, C=US
